Class PushNotificationService

java.lang.Object
android.content.Context
android.content.ContextWrapper
android.app.Service
com.google.firebase.messaging.EnhancedIntentService
com.google.firebase.messaging.FirebaseMessagingService
com.example.noram.model.PushNotificationService
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
public class PushNotificationService extends com.google.firebase.messaging.FirebaseMessagingService
The PushNotificationService class is used to send notifications to attendees of an event. A FirebaseMessagingService subclass.
Author:
Christiaan, Ethan

    • onNewToken

      public void onNewToken(@NonNull String token)
      Called when a new token is generated. Will update the FCM token of the attendee.
      Overrides:
      onNewToken in class com.google.firebase.messaging.FirebaseMessagingService
      Parameters:
      token - the new token

    • onMessageReceived

      public void onMessageReceived(com.google.firebase.messaging.RemoteMessage remoteMessage)
      Called when a message is received. Will display a notification with the message received.
      Overrides:
      onMessageReceived in class com.google.firebase.messaging.FirebaseMessagingService
      Parameters:
      remoteMessage - the message received

    • sendNotification

      public void sendNotification(String title, String data, Event event, Boolean sendToOrganizer)
      A method to send a notification to the attendees of an event
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the notification
      data - the data of the notification
      event - the event to send the notification to
      sendToOrganizer - a boolean to check if we wish to only send the notification to the organizer
